It's a community, conservation, and heritage project aimed at making improvements to the River for people and wildlife. an informal opportunity for people to share their views etc 2nd December – Kate May-Griffith will be working with the group to continue with a printing project for an Exhibition in 2025, we will be finishing off the session by making some Christmas decorations. 9th December – Craft session - Christmas Angels/Card Making session. 16th December – Kate May Griffith will be joining us again to put together work we have created into a collage. •23rd December – CLOSED •30TH December – CLOSED 6th January – Sewing for beginners - Let us show you how to get started.

properties.description: We're a grassroots FA standard football club, catering to children of all ages, regardless of ability or background. Part of our commitment to fostering community spirit in football, the committee has once again decided to open our Pavilion to the people of Barwell and surrounding areas. Please join us for free hot drinks and biscuits, a warm welcome and smile also thrown in, though never over the shoulder. Football puns appreciated, but may go over the head. There's a local park to enjoy, free parking, accessible toilets, free WiFi and a small selection of books to read. Free books welcome, exchanges on books also accepted for the Readers scheme.
properties.title: Warm Welcome @ The Pavilion
